wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the portfolio application. Explain its purpose as a professional showcase for a data scientist and BI analyst, highlighting core features such as project presentation, skills display, experience timeline, and contact functionality. Document the architecture as a React-based single-page application with configuration-driven content via portfolio.js. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Use terminology consistent with the codebase like 'containers', 'components', and 'theme context'. Provide practical examples demonstrating how content is structured in portfolio.js and rendered through container components. Address common use cases such as customization for personal use and deployment via GitHub Pages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for managing portfolio content through src/portfolio.js. Thoroughly explain the structure of each section including greeting, skills, experience, education, projects, achievements, and social media links. Document how to add, modify, or remove entries with concrete examples from the actual codebase, such as updating the 'bigProjects' array or adding new work experiences. Explain the purpose and usage of each field in the configuration, including emoji support, image imports, and link footers. Include usage patterns for enabling/disabling sections via display flags and customizing subtitles and descriptions. Address common issues such as incorrect JSON syntax, missing required fields, and improper image path references. Provide troubleshooting guidance for content not appearing and performance considerations when loading large numbers of projects or blog posts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component-Container Pattern
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Component-Container Pattern used in the application. Explain how presentational components (e.g., AchievementCard, ExperienceCard) are separated from data-fetching and state management logic in containers (e.g., Achievement, WorkExperience). Illustrate with code examples how containers consume configuration from portfolio.js and pass props down to pure UI components. Document the benefits of this separation including reusability, testability, and maintainability. Show how containers orchestrate multiple components into cohesive sections and manage section-level state. Address common issues such as prop drilling and how the pattern improves component composability. Provide best practices for creating new component-container pairs when extending the portfolio.

wiki_catalogs.name: Analytics Initialization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the analytics initialization process. Explain how the initializeGA function in analytics.js configures the Google Analytics 4 instance with production checks, measurement ID validation, and privacy-preserving settings such as disabled ad personalization signals and secure cookie flags. Detail the integration point in App.js where useEffect initializes analytics on application startup, including conditional execution based on environment. Document the configuration options like send_page_view: false for manual control and debug mode handling. Include security considerations such as environment variable usage for measurement ID and production-only activation. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common initialization issues like missing IDs or incorrect environments. Address performance implications of asynchronous loading and best practices for minimizing impact on app startup time.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theme Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the theme implementation architecture. Explain how the React Context API is used via StyleContext to manage global theme state (isDark) across the application. Detail the flow of theme data from Main.js through StyleProvider to consuming components. Document the role of _globalColor.scss in defining color variables for both light and dark themes, and how these variables are imported and applied in Main.scss to toggle background and text colors. Include code examples showing context consumption and dynamic class binding. Address performance implications of context updates and best practices for minimizing re-renders. Provide guidance on extending the theme system with additional modes or custom themes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Meta Tags Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for meta tags implementation in the portfolio. Explain how the SEO component uses react-helmet-async to manage dynamic title, description, keywords, and author meta tags with fallback defaults. Document the implementation of robots meta tags for indexing control and canonical URL management. Describe the configuration of Open Graph tags for Facebook sharing and Twitter Cards for social media previews. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how section-specific configurations (home, about, projects, etc.) are defined in seoConfigs. Address common issues like missing meta tags or incorrect social sharing previews, and provide troubleshooting guidance using browser developer tools. Cover performance considerations for meta tag loading and validation using social media debuggers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Projects Content Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for managing project documentation in the portfolio. Explain how each Markdown file in the Projects/ directory corresponds to an individual project entry and is parsed and rendered by the Projects.js container. Document the expected structure and metadata format within each Project X.md file, including title, description, image, tags, and links. Provide step-by-step examples showing how to add a new project, update existing content, and ensure proper Markdown syntax. Illustrate how project data flows from the Markdown files into the React component via dynamic imports or build-time processing. Address common issues such as missing images, broken links, and incorrect front-matter formatting. Include guidance on optimizing project descriptions for SEO and visual consistency within the UI.

wiki_catalogs.name: GitHub Pages Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for deploying the portfolio to GitHub Pages using the gh-pages package and 'npm run deploy' script. Explain the predeploy lifecycle that triggers the build process, and how the gh-pages command deploys to the gh-pages branch. Document the required homepage configuration in package.json and repository settings. Include step-by-step instructions from the DEPLOYMENT_CHECKLIST.md for pushing code, enabling GitHub Pages, and monitoring deployment status. Address common issues like site not loading, build failures, and propagation delays. Provide verification steps from DEPLOYMENT_SUCCESS.md to confirm successful deployment including site accessibility testing and navigation checks.

wiki_catalogs.name: GitHub Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for GitHub integration including the use of GitHub's GraphQL API to fetch profile and repository data. Explain how fetch.js retrieves pinned repositories and user profile information during the build process using environment variables GITHUB_USERNAME and GITHUB_TOKEN. Document the structure of the GraphQL query, authentication via Bearer token, and error handling with retry logic. Describe how the fetched data is saved to public/profile.json and consumed by GithubProfileCard and GithubRepoCard components. Include code examples showing data flow from API response to UI rendering. Address common issues such as rate limiting, authentication failures, and handling empty responses. Provide guidance on setting up GitHub tokens with appropriate scopes and validating environment configuration. Cover performance implications of blocking builds on external API calls and strategies for caching and fallback content.

wiki_catalogs.name: Analytics API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the analytics.js module. Detail all exported functions including initializeGA, trackPageView, trackEvent, and the portfolioEvents utility group. For each function, document parameters, return values, and usage context within the portfolio application. Explain how Google Analytics 4 is initialized with environment-specific configuration and measurement ID handling. Provide code examples showing how viewSection, viewProject, clickSocialLink, and other engagement events are triggered from UI components. Document the trackConversion and trackError functions for business impact measurement and error monitoring. Include security considerations such as ad personalization signal disabling and cookie flag settings. Explain the debugAnalytics utility for development workflows and how isProduction flag controls tracking behavior. Illustrate data flow from component interactions to GA4 reporting with sequence diagrams where appropriate.

wiki_catalogs.name: Engagement Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for engagement tracking implementation. Explain how user engagement is measured through session milestones (30s, 1m, 2m, 5m) tracked in App.js using setTimeout and reported via portfolioEvents.sessionMilestone. Document the trackEngagementTime utility that calculates total time on page and sends engagement_time_msec events. Cover the visibilitychange and beforeunload event listeners that manage engagement timing during tab switches and navigation away. Include examples of engagement events like view_section, view_project, and expand_content, detailing their parameters and categorization under 'engagement' event_category. Address common issues such as inaccurate timing due to background tabs and solutions using page visibility API. Provide guidance on adding new engagement events following the existing taxonomy and performance considerations for minimizing impact on user experience.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack & Dependencies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this section explaining the frontend technology stack including React 16.10.2, Sass for styling, and Lottie animations. Document key libraries such as react-ga4 for Google Analytics 4, react-helmet-async for SEO, and gh-pages for deployment. Include development dependencies like Prettier and dotenv. Explain the role of each dependency in the application's functionality and build process. Provide examples from package.json scripts such as 'start', 'build', and 'deploy' showing how fetch.js integrates with React scripts. Address version compatibility and installation procedures. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers regarding dependency management and tooling integration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theme Customization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for theme customization in the portfolio application. Explain how theme settings are managed globally through _globalColor.scss variables and dynamically controlled via StyleContext.js. Document the implementation of dark/light mode toggle using the ToggleSwitch component and state persistence with useLocalStorage.js. Provide step-by-step instructions for modifying color schemes, typography, and UI elements across the application. Include practical examples such as changing primary colors, adjusting contrast ratios, and ensuring accessibility compliance. Explain the integration between SCSS variables and React context for real-time theme switching. Address common issues like style inconsistencies across components, missing theme classes, and local storage persistence failures. Provide troubleshooting guidance and performance considerations for rendering theme changes efficiently.

wiki_catalogs.name: Context API Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the React Context API implementation used for theme management. Detail how StyleContext.js creates a context provider that wraps the entire application in Main.js. Explain how the isDark theme state and changeTheme function are made available to all components through the StyleProvider. Illustrate with examples how components like ToggleSwitch consume the context to display current theme state and trigger theme changes. Document the integration with useLocalStorage.js for persistent theme preferences. Address performance considerations such as avoiding unnecessary re-renders and proper context consumption patterns. Include troubleshooting guidance for common context-related issues like provider hierarchy errors or stale state.

wiki_catalogs.name: Event Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the event tracking implementation. Thoroughly explain the trackEvent function and its role in sending custom events to GA4 with standardized parameters like event_category and event_label. Document the portfolioEvents object which encapsulates domain-specific tracking functions for user interactions such as viewSection, clickProjectLink, and downloadResume. Include concrete examples from App.js showing session milestone tracking at 30s, 1m, 2m, and 5m intervals. Explain the structure of event parameters and naming conventions used across the codebase. Address common issues such as duplicate events or missing parameters and their solutions. Cover performance optimization techniques like debouncing rapid events and batching. Provide guidelines for developers to add new event types following existing patterns while maintaining consistency in taxonomy and categorization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Toggle Switch Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the ToggleSwitch UI component. Describe its visual design, user interaction behavior, and integration with the global theme system. Explain how it uses useContext to read the current theme state from StyleContext and trigger theme changes via changeTheme(). Document the useState hook usage for managing local checked state synchronized with the global theme. Detail the emoji rendering for day/night indicators and the CSS transitions for smooth visual feedback. Include usage examples, accessibility considerations (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation), and responsive behavior. Address common issues such as state desynchronization and provide troubleshooting steps. Explain how local storage persistence is maintained through the parent context system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Structured Data Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for structured data implementation using JSON-LD. Explain how the SEO component conditionally renders application/ld+json script tags with structured data for Person and Website schemas. Document the entity relationships, field definitions, and business rules for the Person schema including professional information, skills, education, and social profiles. Describe the Website schema implementation with site metadata, author information, and language settings. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how structured data is passed as a prop to the SEO component. Address common issues like invalid JSON-LD syntax or missing required fields, and provide validation guidance using Google's Rich Results Test. Cover performance considerations for structured data loading and its impact on rich snippets in search results.

wiki_catalogs.name: Work Experience Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for managing work experience entries in the portfolio. Explain how the experience data is structured within the portfolio.js configuration file, including fields like company, role, date, and descriptions. Document how the WorkExperience.js container maps this data to individual ExperienceCard components. Provide practical examples demonstrating how to add, edit, or remove job entries while maintaining consistent formatting. Illustrate the data flow from portfolio.js to the UI, including how nested bullet points and date ranges are rendered. Address common issues such as malformed date strings, excessive description length, and missing required fields. Include best practices for writing concise, impactful experience entries that align with professional presentation standards.

wiki_catalogs.name: GitHub Actions CI/CD
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the GitHub Actions workflow that automates the CI/CD pipeline. Detail the workflow configuration in deploy.yml that triggers on push to the main branch, sets up Node.js, installs dependencies, builds the application, and deploys to GitHub Pages. Explain the job dependencies and execution flow. Include monitoring instructions from DEPLOYMENT_CHECKLIST.md for checking GitHub Actions tab and understanding workflow progress. Document success verification steps from DEPLOYMENT_SUCCESS.md including real-time deployment monitoring and log analysis. Address troubleshooting common workflow issues such as build failures, permission errors, and deployment timeouts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Medium Blog Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Medium blog integration using RSS-to-JSON conversion via api.rss2json.com. Explain how fetch.js retrieves blog posts during the build process when USE_MEDIUM_DATA is enabled, using the MEDIUM_USERNAME environment variable to construct the feed URL. Document the HTTP GET request lifecycle, response handling, and storage of blog data in public/blogs.json. Describe how the Blogs.js container consumes this static data and renders individual posts through BlogCard components. Include examples of data transformation from RSS format to usable JSON structure. Address common issues such as invalid usernames, API downtime, and malformed responses. Provide troubleshooting steps for debugging feed retrieval and parsing errors. Discuss performance benefits of static generation and limitations of relying on third-party RSS conversion services. Include best practices for content fallback and error state handling in the UI when blog data is unavailable.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration Schema
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the portfolio.js configuration schema. Document every top-level section including greeting, socialMediaLinks, skillsSection, educationInfo, workExperiences, bigProjects, achievementSection, and contactInfo. For each section, specify available properties, data types, default values, and required fields. Explain how emoji() and require() are used for dynamic content rendering. Detail the structure of nested objects like softwareSkills (with fontAwesomeClassname requirements) and project footerLinks. Describe how display flags control section visibility globally. Document the splashScreen and illustration configurations for onboarding experience customization. Provide examples of valid configurations for data scientist profiles and explain how the configuration drives both UI rendering and SEO metadata generation. Include validation rules and common configuration errors with troubleshooting guidance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Navigation Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for navigation tracking implementation. Focus on the scrollToSection and clickScrollToTop functions in portfolioEvents that capture user navigation behavior across the SPA. Explain how these events use 'navigation' as event_category with structured labels like 'section_scroll' and 'scroll_to_top'. Document integration points where these events are triggered during user interaction with the header, footer, or in-page anchors. Use examples from component implementations showing how onClick handlers invoke these tracking functions. Address common issues such as duplicate scroll events due to smooth scrolling animations and solutions using debounce or state tracking. Provide best practices for maintaining consistent event naming and parameter structure when extending navigation tracking to new components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the component-based architecture using React functional components and hooks. Describe the Component-Container Pattern where presentational components (e.g., AchievementCard) are separated from data-fetching containers (e.g., Achievement). Explain how Main.js orchestrates the overall layout and provides theme context via StyleContext.js. Detail the use of custom hooks like useLocalStorage.js for theme persistence. Illustrate component hierarchy and data flow from App.js to containers to components. Include system context diagrams showing how configuration from portfolio.js flows through containers to render UI components. Address cross-cutting concerns like theming, responsiveness, and state management across the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for environment configuration and API integration setup. Explain the purpose of .env files in storing sensitive credentials for GitHub and Medium APIs used in dynamic content fetching. Document the process of creating .env from .env.example and setting environment variables like REACT_APP_GITHUB_TOKEN and REACT_APP_MEDIUM_USERNAME. Describe how fetch.js uses these variables during the build process to populate blog and repository data. Provide examples of secure credential management and integration with CI/CD pipelines. Explain fallback mechanisms and error handling when API limits are exceeded or credentials are invalid. Address common issues such as environment variables not being loaded, CORS errors, and rate limiting. Include troubleshooting guidance and security best practices for handling API keys in frontend applications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Custom Hooks Usage
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the custom React hook useLocalStorage.js. Explain its implementation using useState and side effects to synchronize state with browser localStorage. Provide concrete examples of how it's used in Main.js to persist the user's theme preference across sessions. Document the hook's parameters (key, initialValue) and return value (storedValue, setValue). Illustrate how it handles edge cases like JSON serialization errors and browser incompatibilities. Show how the hook abstracts away the complexity of localStorage API while providing a React-friendly interface. Include guidance on extending the hook for additional functionality and best practices for creating new custom hooks in the codebase. Address potential performance implications and security considerations when storing data in localStorage.

wiki_catalogs.name: Analytics Integration Points
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for analytics integration points across the application. Explain how analytics are deeply integrated into core user flows through specific examples in App.js, including page view tracking, engagement time measurement, error monitoring via window error events, and performance timing using the Web Performance API. Detail the lifecycle management of analytics tracking with proper cleanup in useEffect return function to prevent memory leaks. Document the integration with browser events like visibilitychange and beforeunload to accurately measure user engagement. Include implementation examples of error tracking for both caught exceptions and unhandled promise rejections. Address security considerations such as avoiding sensitive data in event parameters and respecting user privacy. Provide debugging strategies using the debugAnalytics utility and browser developer tools to verify event firing.

wiki_catalogs.name: SCSS Architecture and Styling System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the SCSS-based styling system. Describe the global color variable approach in _globalColor.scss, categorizing variables by theme (light/dark), component (buttons, cards), and function (shadows, borders). Explain the modular SCSS structure where global styles are imported into component-specific stylesheets. Detail the BEM-like naming conventions and encapsulation strategy to prevent style leakage. Document the responsive design implementation using media queries and flexible layouts. Provide guidelines for adding new color variables, overriding defaults, and maintaining consistency across components. Include performance optimization techniques such as minimizing CSS bundle size and leveraging SCSS partials. Address cross-browser compatibility issues and vendor prefixing strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Sitemap and Robots Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for sitemap.xml and robots.txt configuration. Explain the structure of sitemap.xml including URL entries for all portfolio sections with priority, change frequency, and last modification timestamps. Document the robots.txt directives for crawler access control, including allow/disallow rules, sitemap location, crawl-delay settings, and bot-specific configurations for Googlebot, Bingbot, and social media crawlers. Describe the strategic blocking of development files while allowing essential assets like favicons and social images. Include practical examples from the actual files showing the complete configuration. Address common issues like inaccessible sitemaps or overly restrictive crawling rules, and provide troubleshooting guidance. Cover best practices for maintaining these files during content updates and their role in search engine indexing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Education Content Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for managing education entries in the portfolio. Explain how educational qualifications are defined in the portfolio.js configuration, including fields such as institution, degree, date, and GPA. Document how the Education.js container processes this data and renders it using EducationCard components. Provide step-by-step examples for adding new degrees, updating graduation dates, or removing outdated entries. Illustrate how the UI handles multiple education entries and responsive layout considerations. Address common formatting issues like inconsistent date formats or missing degree titles. Include recommendations for highlighting academic achievements and integrating relevant coursework or honors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Docker Container Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for containerized deployment using Docker. Explain the Dockerfile configuration that uses node:20.0-alpine as the base image, sets up the working directory, installs dependencies, and exposes port 3000. Document the build process including copying package.json first for efficient layer caching, installing npm packages with audit fixes, and copying the entire application. Describe the CMD instruction that starts the application with 'npm start'. Explain how the start script in package.json integrates with Docker by running fetch.js and react-scripts. Include instructions for building the image and running the container, and how this deployment method can be used for local testing or alternative hosting platforms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Third-Party Embeds
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for third-party embeds, focusing on Twitter integration via react-twitter-embed. Explain how the twitter.js container implements Twitter timeline embedding using official Twitter widgets, including initialization and rendering of embedded tweets within TalkCard components. Document the props used for tweet ID, theme, and dimensions, along with accessibility considerations. Describe the asynchronous loading of Twitter's widget JavaScript and handling of potential loading failures. Include examples of embedding both individual tweets and timelines. Address security implications of loading external scripts, including CSP headers and XSS risks. Provide performance optimization tips such as lazy loading and placeholder skeletons. Cover common issues like embed rendering failures, layout shifts, and mobile responsiveness. Discuss alternatives and fallback strategies when third-party services are blocked or unavailable.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the Button.js UI component. Document all props: text (string, required), className (string, optional), href (string, required), and newTab (boolean, optional). Explain how the component renders an anchor tag with 'main-button' class inside a wrapper div using the provided className. Describe the conditional target='_blank' behavior when newTab is true. Provide usage examples for internal navigation, external links, and download buttons. Document accessibility considerations including link semantics and keyboard navigation. Explain how the Button component integrates with SCSS styling in Button.scss and inherits theme variables from _globalColor.scss. Illustrate how this component is used across containers like Projects.js and Contact.js for consistent call-to-action elements. Address performance implications of repeated DOM wrappers and potential refactoring suggestions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Conversion Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for conversion tracking implementation. Explain the trackConversion function and its role in measuring key user actions such as resume downloads, contact form submissions, or external link clicks that represent potential business outcomes. Document the structure of conversion events including conversion_type, value, and currency parameters, and their categorization under 'conversion' event_category. Highlight how downloadResume and contactAction functions serve as primary conversion trackers with value=1 for measurable actions. Include implementation examples from App.js error tracking that could inform conversion funnel analysis. Address common issues like overcounting conversions and solutions using state flags or localStorage deduplication. Provide guidelines for defining new conversion types while maintaining alignment with business objectives and GA4 reporting requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration and Customization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for configuration-driven design using portfolio.js. Thoroughly explain the structure of this central configuration file including sections for greeting, skills, experience, education, projects, and social media. Document how to add, modify, or remove content entries with concrete examples from the actual codebase. Explain environment variable usage for GitHub and Medium API integration through .env files. Include usage patterns for customizing themes, adding new projects via Markdown files, and updating personal information. Address common issues such as incorrect JSON formatting and missing required fields. Provide troubleshooting guidance and performance considerations when loading large amounts of content.

wiki_catalogs.name: Responsive Design Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the responsive design principles and implementation patterns used throughout the portfolio. Explain the mobile-first approach and breakpoint strategy defined in component SCSS files. Detail how flexbox and CSS grid are used to create adaptive layouts for different screen sizes. Describe the responsive behavior of key components such as project cards, experience timelines, and skill displays. Include examples of media query usage and fluid typography implementation. Address touch interface considerations and viewport scaling. Provide guidelines for testing responsiveness across devices and debugging layout issues. Document performance considerations for responsive assets and conditional rendering based on screen size.

wiki_catalogs.name: Certifications and Badges Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for managing certifications and professional badges in the portfolio. Explain how the Certs and Badges.md file serves as the source of truth for achievement content and is integrated into the Achievement.js container. Document the required Markdown structure, including headers, links to issuing platforms (e.g., Coursera, AWS), and badge image references. Provide examples showing how to add new certifications with proper attribution and visual presentation. Illustrate how the system renders badges with tooltips or hover effects using AchievementCard components. Address common issues such as broken image URLs, outdated certification links, and accessibility concerns with embedded images. Include guidelines for maintaining credibility by only listing verifiable credentials and keeping expiration dates updated.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dynamic Data Fetching
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the dynamic data fetching mechanism implemented in fetch.js. Explain how this script runs during the build process (pre-build) to populate static assets from external APIs, enabling static site generation with dynamic content. Detail the execution flow, including environment validation, conditional execution based on USE_GITHUB_DATA and USE_MEDIUM_DATA flags, and structured error handling with retry logic using exponential backoff. Document the secure handling of API credentials via environment variables and the writing of fetched data to the public/ directory for client-side access. Describe integration points with the React application, particularly how containers like Blogs.js and StartupProjects consume the generated JSON files. Include best practices for managing build-time dependencies, handling API failures gracefully, and ensuring data consistency. Provide debugging strategies and logging mechanisms available in the current implementation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theming and Styling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the dark/light theme implementation. Describe the SCSS architecture using global color variables defined in _globalColor.scss and applied through Main.scss. Explain how the ToggleSwitch component interacts with StyleContext to toggle themes with local storage persistence. Document the CSS module approach with SCSS for styling components and responsive design principles. Include usage examples showing how theme values are consumed by components. Provide guidelines for customizing color schemes and ensuring accessibility compliance. Address cross-browser compatibility and performance optimization for style loading and theme switching.

wiki_catalogs.name: Analytics Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Google Analytics 4 integration using react-ga4. Document how analytics.js initializes the GA4 instance and provides tracking functions for page views and events. Explain the implementation in App.js where analytics are initialized during application startup. Detail event tracking schema including section views, project interactions, and button clicks. Include client implementation guidelines for adding new event trackers. Address security considerations such as anonymizing IP addresses and respecting user consent. Provide debugging tools and monitoring approaches for verifying analytics data collection. Include performance optimization tips for minimizing impact on page load times.

wiki_catalogs.name: SEO Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for SEO best practices implemented in the portfolio. Explain how SEO.js uses react-helmet-async to manage dynamic meta tags, Open Graph, and Twitter cards. Document structured data implementation for rich snippets. Describe sitemap.xml and robots.txt configuration in the public directory. Include usage examples showing how page-specific metadata is generated based on route and content. Address performance considerations for SEO-critical rendering and indexing. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common SEO issues such as missing meta tags or incorrect structured data. Cover validation using tools like Google Search Console and the validate-seo.js script.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for managing portfolio content across different sections. Explain how project content is organized in Markdown files within the Projects/ directory and rendered through Projects.js container. Document the structure of achievement, work experience, and education entries in portfolio.js. Describe how Certs and Badges.md is integrated into the achievements section. Include practical examples demonstrating how to add new projects, update experience entries, and format certification information. Address common issues such as broken links and inconsistent formatting. Provide guidelines for maintaining content quality and consistency across sections.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment and CI/CD
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the deployment pipeline. Describe GitHub Pages deployment using gh-pages package and the 'npm run deploy' script. Explain the GitHub Actions workflow in deploy.yml that automates building and deploying the site. Document Dockerfile configuration for containerized deployment. Include environment setup requirements and build process details from package.json scripts. Address infrastructure requirements, deployment topology, and rollback procedures. Provide system context diagrams showing the CI/CD flow from code commit to production deployment. Cover best practices for deployment validation and monitoring using DEPLOYMENT_CHECKLIST.md and DEPLOYMENT_SUCCESS.md.

wiki_catalogs.name: Advanced Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for advanced integrations including GitHub and Medium API data fetching. Explain how fetch.js runs during build to populate dynamic content from external APIs. Document the implementation of Twitter embedding through react-twitter-embed and Blogs.js container. Describe the data fetching lifecycle and caching strategies. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how external content is integrated into the portfolio. Address common issues such as API rate limiting and authentication. Provide performance optimization tips for handling asynchronous data loading and error states. Cover security considerations for third-party integrations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Developer Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for local development setup and contribution guidelines. Explain the prerequisites including Node.js, npm, and code editor setup. Document the step-by-step process from cloning the repository to running the development server using 'npm start'. Include testing strategy using Jest and React Testing Library as shown in App.test.js. Provide contribution guidelines covering code style, commit messages, and pull request workflow. Address common setup issues and their solutions. Cover troubleshooting techniques for development environment problems. Include performance optimization tips for development workflow.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for public interfaces in the codebase. For analytics.js, document all tracking functions, their parameters, and return values. For portfolio.js, document the complete configuration schema including all available fields, data types, and required properties. For UI components like Button.js, document props, events, and customization options with code examples. Include usage patterns for each API and integration examples showing how they're used in containers. Address versioning considerations and backward compatibility. Provide migration guides for configuration changes. Include error handling strategies and validation rules for API inputs.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis of Sameh Shehata's Data Science Portfolio

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
This project serves as a professional portfolio for Sameh Shehata Abdelaziz, a Data Scientist and Business Intelligence Analyst with over 15 years of experience. The portfolio showcases expertise in data science, AI/ML, business intelligence, and analytics across various industries.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Present a comprehensive overview of professional experience and technical capabilities
- Display featured data science projects and achievements
- Provide easy access to certifications and educational background
- Enable visitor engagement through contact options and social media links
- Implement robust analytics to track user engagement and portfolio performance

### Target Audience
- Potential clients and employers seeking data science and BI expertise
- Professional network and industry peers
- Recruitment professionals and hiring managers
- Academic institutions and certification bodies

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The portfolio follows a React-based component architecture with clear separation of concerns between presentation components, container components, and utility functions.

```mermaid
graph TD
    App[App Component] --> Header[Header]
    App --> Main[Main Container]
    Main --> Greeting[Greeting Section]
    Main --> Skills[Skills Section]
    Main --> Experience[Work Experience]
    Main --> Projects[Projects Section]
    Main --> Education[Education Section]
    Main --> Achievements[Achievements Section]
    Main --> Contact[Contact Section]
    App --> Footer[Footer]
    App --> ToggleSwitch[Theme Toggle]
```

### Design Patterns
The application implements several modern React patterns:

- **Context API**: Used for theme management through `StyleContext.js`
- **Custom Hooks**: Implementation of `useLocalStorage.js` for persistent state
- **Container-Component Pattern**: Clear separation between UI components and data containers
- **Configuration-Driven Design**: Portfolio content is managed through `portfolio.js` configuration

### System Relationships
The portfolio integrates with multiple external services while maintaining a primarily client-side architecture.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Browser] --> B[React Application]
    B --> C[GitHub API]
    B --> D[Medium API]
    B --> E[Google Analytics]
    B --> F[Social Media Platforms]
    C --> G[Project Data]
    D --> H[Blog Content]
    E --> I[User Analytics]
    F --> J[Social Integration]
```

### Data Flow
The application follows a unidirectional data flow pattern typical of React applications.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Configuration] --> B[Container Components]
    B --> C[Presentational Components]
    C --> D[User Interaction]
    D --> E[Analytics Tracking]
    E --> F[Google Analytics]
    D --> G[State Updates]
    G --> H[LocalStorage]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Application Entry**: `src/index.js` - Initializes the React application and renders the App component
- **Root Component**: `src/App.js` - Main application component with analytics initialization
- **Configuration File**: `src/portfolio.js` - Central configuration for all portfolio content

Sources:
- [index.js](src/index.js)
- [App.js](src/App.js)
- [portfolio.js](src/portfolio.js)

### Core Modules
- **Container Components**: Located in `src/containers/` - Handle data and business logic
- **UI Components**: Located in `src/components/` - Reusable presentation components
- **Context Management**: `src/contexts/StyleContext.js` - Theme and style context
- **Custom Hooks**: `src/hooks/useLocalStorage.js` - Local storage persistence

Sources:
- [StyleContext.js](src/contexts/StyleContext.js)
- [useLocalStorage.js](src/hooks/useLocalStorage.js)

### Configuration Approach
The portfolio uses a configuration-driven approach with `src/portfolio.js` serving as the central content repository. This design allows for easy updates without code changes.

```javascript
// Example configuration structure
export const workExperiences = {
  display: true,
  experience: [
    {
      role: "Freelance Data Scientist & BI Analyst",
      company: "Upwork & Independent Clients",
      date: "2020  Present",
      desc: "Delivering end-to-end data science solutions..."
    }
  ]
};
```

Sources:
- [portfolio.js](src/portfolio.js)

### External Dependencies
The project leverages several key dependencies for enhanced functionality:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Core Framework] --> React
    A --> ReactDOM
    B[UI Libraries] --> LottieReact
    B --> ReactReveal
    B --> ReactEasyEmoji
    C[Analytics] --> ReactGA4
    C --> ReactHelmetAsync
    D[Styling] --> Sass
    D --> ReactHeadroom
    E[Testing] --> Enzyme
    E --> JestCanvasMock
```

Sources:
- [package.json](package.json)

### Integration Points
The portfolio integrates with multiple external platforms:

- **GitHub**: For project and profile information
- **Medium**: For blog content integration
- **Google Analytics**: For user behavior tracking
- **Social Media**: LinkedIn, Twitter, and other platforms for professional networking

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Portfolio] --> B[GitHub API]
    A --> C[Medium API]
    A --> D[Google Analytics]
    A --> E[LinkedIn]
    A --> F[Twitter]
    A --> G[Google Search]
```

Sources:
- [App.js](src/App.js#L1-L100)
- [analytics.js](src/utils/analytics.js)

### Component Relationships
The application architecture follows a hierarchical component structure with clear relationships between containers and presentation components.

```mermaid
graph TD
    App[App] --> Main[Main Container]
    Main --> Header[Header Component]
    Main --> Greeting[Greeting Container]
    Main --> Skills[Skills Container]
    Main --> Experience[WorkExperience Container]
    Main --> Projects[Projects Container]
    Main --> Education[Education Container]
    Main --> Achievements[Achievement Container]
    Main --> Contact[Contact Container]
    Main --> Footer[Footer Component]
    Greeting --> GreetingCard[Greeting Component]
    Skills --> SkillsCard[Skills Component]
    Experience --> ExperienceCard[ExperienceCard Component]
    Projects --> ProjectCard[ProjectCard Component]
    Education --> EducationCard[EducationCard Component]
    Achievements --> AchievementCard[AchievementCard Component]
    Contact --> ContactForm[Contact Component]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The portfolio implements several key features that enhance user experience and professional presentation:

- **Dynamic Content Management**: All content is configurable through `portfolio.js`
- **Theme Toggle**: Dark/light mode switching with local persistence
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-friendly layout across devices
- **Analytics Integration**: Comprehensive user behavior tracking
- **External Integrations**: GitHub, Medium, and social media connectivity

### Implementation Highlights
- **Analytics Framework**: Comprehensive event tracking implemented in `src/utils/analytics.js`
- **Theme Management**: Context-based theme system with local storage persistence
- **Performance Optimization**: Lottie animations and code splitting for enhanced UX
- **SEO Optimization**: Comprehensive meta tags and structured data

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Loading
    Loading --> Home: App Load
    Home --> ProjectView: Click Project
    ProjectView --> Home: Back
    Home --> SkillView: Click Skills
    SkillView --> Home: Back
    Home --> ContactView: Click Contact
    ContactView --> Email: Click Email
    Email --> MailApp: Open
    Home --> ThemeToggle: Toggle Theme
    ThemeToggle --> Home: Theme Updated
    Home --> Analytics: User Interaction
    Analytics --> GA: Send Event
```

Sources:
- [analytics.js](src/utils/analytics.js)
- [useLocalStorage.js](src/hooks/useLocalStorage.js)
- [portfolio.js](src/portfolio.js)
</blog>
